channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Google launches a lawsuit targeting text message scammers
item.description: Ever gotten a text saying you forgot to pay a nonexistent road toll or need to pick up a mystery package? Google's going after the scammers behind tho...

item.title: They found a 'bucket of lentils.' Then it blew up. The menace of Gaza's unexploded ordnance
item.description: The United Nations Mine Action Service estimates between 5% and 10% of Israeli weapons fired into Gaza in the past two years failed to detonate, and u...

item.title: The shutdown could be nearing its end, but high demand for food assistance lingers
item.description: The Capital Area Food Bank in Washington D.C., says it's allotted an extra 1 million meals for November, given the uncertainties about whether and whe...

item.title: Once upon a time, nostalgia was epidemic among homesick soldiers
item.description: The word began as a medical diagnosis but over the centuries has evolved to mean the longing for a bygone, idealized past.

item.title: It's harder to get home insurance. That's changing communities across the U.S.
item.description: Home insurance is getting less affordable, and less available, as insurers raise prices and pull back from areas with extreme weather. That's forcing ...

item.title: Search continues for coal miner trapped inside flooded mine in West Virginia
item.description: Local, state and federal agencies are searching for a missing coal miner who became trapped inside a flooded mine on Saturday in West Virginia.

item.title: Deal to end shutdown moves to full House for final vote
item.description: The Senate-passed bill to end the record-long government shutdown moved to the full House for a final vote after a key House panel advanced it early W...

item.title: A historic shutdown is nearly over. It leaves no winners and much frustration
item.description: The longest government shutdown in history could conclude as soon as Day 43 with almost no one happy with the final result.

item.title: 42 migrants presumed dead after boat sinks off Libya's coast, U.N. says
item.description: The United Nations says 42 migrants are missing, presumed dead after boat capsizes off Libya's coast, with only seven rescued after six days adrift.

item.title: Jack Schlossberg, JFK's grandson, launches NY congressional bid
item.description: The only grandson of John F. Kennedy, Jack Schlossberg, is vying to become the latest Kennedy family scion to enter Congress.

item.title: Trump says he has 'obligation' to sue BBC over speech edit
item.description: The US president indicates he will go ahead with a lawsuit against the BBC over how his speech was presented by Panorama.

item.title: Watch: Australian windsurfer escapes shark attack
item.description: Andy McDonald recalls moment he encountered a shark while windsurfing in Western Australia this week.

item.title: Brothers charged with South African rapper's murder after extradition
item.description: The Ndimande brothers returned after a lengthy battle to block their extradition from Eswatini.

item.title: Wife and son of Gabon's ousted leader given 20-year jail terms in two-day corruption trial
item.description: They were not in court and have described the charges against them as “a legal farce”.

item.title: 3 Bob Ross paintings fetch over $600,000 for public TV; 27 still on block
item.description: Three paintings from public television legend Bob Ross sold for more than $600,000 at auction. They were the first of 30 Ross works being sold to bene...

item.title: Fog helps Russian forces push deeper into key Ukrainian city of Pokrovsk
item.description: A video has gone viral showing Russian soldiers openly driving into the city on civilian cars and motorbikes.

item.title: What to know about the status of SNAP food aid as a vote nears to end the shutdown
There’s no timeline on when flight cuts will ease up after the government shutdown ends
